sentences.en: " That's coffee candy to cajole children with,'said Hsin - mei , suddenly understanding.
sentences.cn: 辛楣 恍然大悟道: “ 这是哄小孩子的咖啡方糖——”

sentences.en: Cajole ( sth . ) out of [ from ] sb.
sentences.cn: 甜言蜜语骗 走 某人的 ( 某物 )

sentences.en: Do you think you can cajole some money out of your father?
sentences.cn: 你认为你能从你父亲那里骗到一些钱吗?。

sentences.en: Employers used to dictating terms to their Chinese workforce are learning to beg, plead and cajole.
sentences.cn: 过去常常对中国工人颐指气使的雇主,现在正学着恳请 、 乞求与哄骗.

sentences.en: He would go to him - threaten, cajole, actually destroy him, if necessary.
sentences.cn: 他要去看他 —— 威胁 、 利诱 、 倘使需要的话, 就把他彻头彻尾地毁灭.

sentences.en: I am not going to cajole you into the reception of my view.
sentences.cn: 我并不是要哄你接受我的观点.

sentences.en: If a person often have lies flow and mouth, thus to cajole others, over time, he would lose the trust of the people.
sentences.cn: 一个人如果经常有谎言流与口中，从而去哄骗他人，久而久之，他便会失去人们的信任。

sentences.en: If they no longer do, that is because of the new vernaculars invented to cajole automatons into doing man’s bidding.
sentences.cn: 如果人们不再这样以为了，那是因为一些新的语言被发明了出来用于哄骗机器人，使之屈服于人类。

sentences.en: It is difficult to cajole him into consent.
Such perceived deficiencies have hobbled his ability to cajole China with any real conviction.
sentences.cn: 这样的缺陷束缚了奥巴马以切实可信的言语笼络中国的能力.

sentences.en: The enemy tried every means to cajole him into telling the information.
sentences.cn: 敌人想尽一切办法诱迫他说出情报.

sentences.en: While Capello is perceived as a harsh manager, he will have to console and cajole, too.
sentences.cn: 虽然卡佩罗被认为是一名苛刻的教练, 但他必须要学会安慰和哄骗球员.

trans.tran_cn: 以甜言蜜语哄骗, 勾引
trans.tran_en: to gradually persuade someone to do something by being nice to them, or making promises to them
